title: What happened to the trenches of WW1? What condition are they in present day? - Quora

response.answer_text: On the Western Front the majority have been returned to farmland and are invisible, there are many sections of Trenches that are preserved as memorials, Neiport in Belgium, Vimy Ridge, Verdun are ones that spring to mind but there are many more Some of the preserved ones have been maintained to show exactly what they were like, others have just been left and a less clear

They were first cleared of bodies, barbed wire ammunition, and anything else left behind. Then they were filled in, and most resumed being used for agriculture as before the war. Most can't be seen now, however there are traces remaining even today. Some trenches have been preserved such as at the Vimy ridge memorial.
